comment: The class is not a safe place for "dumb" questions, and she can make you feel like you shouldn't have even opened your mouth to speak. She rushes all of her lectures but sometimes she still runs class long. I did better teaching myself than learning from her, and I still barely scraped by. If you struggle with math, she doesn't make it any easier.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: The homework can be completed in a few hours and is ALEKS based, so I'm not sure what people mean by a ton of homework. She really wants you to succeed and has gone out of her way to help. You can not skip homework and lectures and expect to pass or understand the material. She volunteers her time after class to tutor in an open math lab as well.

I love this woman with my whole heart. She teaches very thoroughly and will explain if you ask questions. She does assign a lot of homework on ALEKS, but it's honestly super helpful and gives great practice. She gives you a practice test on ALEKS before exams, and they are almost exactly the same. I 10/10 recommend her for college algebra!

She makes college algebra even easier than it is. She walks you through examples in class, and the ALEKS homework covers all the material that will be on tests. As long as you attend class, review notes, and do the homework, the tests will be straightforward. She's also very nice, funny, and genuinely cares to help you pass.
Professor Naidu was god awful, she was impossible to get in touch with, rude in person, and went really fast through all the lectures without letting us ask any questions.

She is the best Math professor I have had. Her grading is clear and she truly wants you to do your best and will outright tell you how important it is to study and sacrifices need to be made. She makes use of ALEKs and attendance is not mandatory but it is helpful to hear her lectures. She gives ample tutoring opportunity.

Nice and sometimes funny that's why she got a 2. She goes WAY TOO FAST in the lectures and expects you to retain all the information. Lots of homework every week. No test makeup. If you are not good at math, don't take her. You are basically being taught by ALEKS. Not supportive or understanding during lectures when people don't understand.

If you struggle with math I wouldn't suggest this class. She posts online lectures but they're for her in-person class not her online class. There were about 14-18 homework assignments due every week on ALEKS. You're basically learning off of ALEKS, she does answer emails fairly quickly, However I didn't learn much. Don't take her online class.

Dr. Naidu is very sweet and passionate. She is heavy on homework and you have to pay $100 to access the site to complete them on. No textbooks though. She records all the lectures which is great if you need to review anything you don't understand. Nice teacher, but stressful class.

Dr. Naidu was probably the sweetest and humble professor i have taken. If you have a question, she'll do whatever it takes to answer it. The hw is going to take a while to do, so i recommend not doing it the night it's due. Tests are fairly easy and lowest test grade gets replaced with the final. Overall, if you are able to take her, TAKE HER

This class was okay. She uses ALEKS, which is basically where you do all your homework, tests, and assignments. It's easy to navigate but when there's a problem with it the teacher is sometimes hard to get in touch with. Super unmotivated at times when it came to those dumb knowledge checks, but other than that DO THE PRACTICE TESTS!! They help.
Attend class. Crazy amount of homework. Do practice tests
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I never went to one zoom call and I have an A. All you do is aleks each week and then you have 4 tests. The tests are lockdown & webcam. She gives you study guides for the tests and you can take it as many times as you want. If you do the study guide youll be fine. The tests are only 25 questions & she gives partial credit for wrong answers
If you want to drown in homework take her. She uses a math hw site called aleks and it makes me want to kill myself. Dont take her.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework

comment: makes class extremely difficult for no reason
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is a very spirited teacher. She is willing to go as far as to let you attend her other classes if you need extra help. She is funny even though some of her jokes might be a little dry. Also her tests are basically the practice tests except the numbers are changed out.
